SENT.plain: Antiphospholipid syndrome is a disorder of recurrent vascular thrombosis, pregnancy loss and thrombocytopenia associated with persistently elevated levels of antiphospholipid antibodies
It was first described in a group of patients with systemic lupus erythematosus but has since been associated with a wide range of conditions, including other autoimmune disorders and malignancy
It can also occur in isolation, the so-called primary antiphospholipid syndrome
We describe an elderly woman with the antiphospholipid syndrome thought to be associated with a cholangiocarcinoma
